definition: Jiang Wen (1963-), sixth generation Chinese movie director

sentences.english: Jiang Wen is at the top of the world - the world of Chinese cinema, that is.
sentences.chinese: 姜文登上了中国电影界的巅峰。

sentences.english: Actor-director Jiang Wen is a pillar of the Chinese film industry.
sentences.chinese: 演员兼导演姜文是中国电影界的栋梁。

sentences.english: Jiang Wen to 'Let the Bullets Fly' in Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 姜文的《让子弹飞》在好莱坞翻拍版。

sentences.english: Yet, Jiang repeatedly uses the location as an outing to the murky world of genre-film making.
sentences.chinese: 然而在电影里，姜文屡次地把这个地方比作深入险境。

sentences.english: The most unforgettable role that I think is Jiang Wen as Mao Renfeng.
sentences.chinese: 最令人难忘的应该是姜文扮演的毛人凤。

definition: Gong Li (1965-), PRC female film star
Wang Shuo (1958-), Chinese writer, director and actor
Wong Kar-wai (1956-), Hong Kong film director
Joan Chen (1961-), Chinese born American actress
Johnnie To (1955-), Hong Kong film director
Tsui Hark (1951-), Chinese movie director and producer
Stephen Chow (1962-), Hong Kong actor, comedian, screenwriter and film director, known for his mo lei tau 無厘頭|无厘头[wu2 li2 tou2] movies
Chow Yun-Fat (1955-), Hong Kong TV and film star
to succeed in life/to become somebody
Jackie Chan (1954-), kungfu film and Cantopop star
